translation.en: [man 1] Mayday, mayday! We are under attack.
translation.ko: "치명적 무력 사용 허가 구역" 구조 바람, 공격당하고 있다

translation.en: Under attack from our own people.
They just started shooting. They took out everyone.
-[man 2] Why are they doing this? -[man 1] They're ours. What's happening?
translation.ko: - 뭐 하는 거야? - 아군이잖아, 어떻게 된 거야?

translation.en: [man 1] How many are there?
[man 2] They're everywhere! They're going for the command center.
translation.ko: 그들은 사방에 있다 통제실로 가고 있다

translation.en: They're going to take out the interceptors.
translation.ko: 인터셉터를 장악하려 한다 "미군의 미사일 조기 경보 통제소는 두 곳이 있으며"

translation.en: [man 1] They're killing us, they're killing everybody!
They reached the command center. I can't hold them off!
translation.ko: 통제실에 접근했다 더는 막을 수가 없다!

translation.en: [man 2] Somebody help us! Please, send help!
[man 1] We've got to call SBX-1.
[man 2] We can't! They destroyed the transmitter!
[man 1] This is Fort Greely. We have been overrun. Fort Greely--
translation.ko: 여기는 그릴리 기지 우리는 적에게 제압당했다

translation.en: [pilot] Coming up on SBX-1 now, Captain.
[pilot] SBX-1 this is Eagle 6-7.
I got your new missile system specialist here with me.
translation.ko: 새 미사일 체계 전문가를 모셔 왔다

translation.en: Request permission to commence final approach.
[operator] Eagle 6-7 this is SBX-1, you're cleared for landing.
Welcome to the middle of nowhere.
Captain Collins, I'm Ensign Washington.
Welcome to SBX-1,
or should I say "welcome back."
-Thanks. -[Washington] Colonel's waiting for you.
I heard you grew up in Spain at a base your dad was posted at.
translation.ko: 스페인에서 자라셨다고 들었어요 부친께서 거기 주둔하셨다고

translation.en: [male voice] Come in.
Captain Collins reporting, sir.
At ease.
Good to see you again, JJ.
You remember Captain Welsh?
Yes, sir. You were just taking over when I rotated out.
Don't you mean escaped?
[Welsh] Listen to this.
-Give us a minute, would you, Lou? -You bet.
See if you can get us an update on that Russian sub.
translation.ko: 러시아 잠수함에 관해 새 소식 있나 알아보고

translation.en: Well, as you can see,
everything's pretty much the way you left it.
Navy runs the boat, Army handles the missiles,
and everyone wants to be anywhere but here.
-Have you spoke with the board? -Three times.
[Collins] Showed them my record? My reviews?
Everything.
This was the best you could do?
Sorry.
[Marshall] No, it's okay.
I thought I was done with this shit.
translation.ko: 엿 같은 일은 다 극복한 줄 알았는데

translation.en: [Marshall] I know.
Never going to change, is it?
Thank you for taking me back.
For the record, I believed you from the start.
[Washington] We got you down here.
One of our guys nabbed your old room.
Sorry about that.
Oh, ma'am?
Just want to say
all of us girls are really proud of what you did.
What happened to you, well it's…
It's happened to a lot of us,
and I just wanted you to know that.
I need you in the command center with your sidearm now.
translation.ko: 개인 화기 지참해서 당장 통제실로 와라

translation.en: We have an active shooter situation at Fort Greely.
Outsider?
No, one of ours. Looks like more than one.
translation.ko: 아니, 내부 소행이야 한 명이 아닌 것 같아

translation.en: [Collins] Interceptors secure?
[Marshall] Unknown.
[Collins] How bad is it?
Greely's gone dark. No calls in or out.
We're getting all our information off Twitter.
[Marshall] Do we have Fort Greely on the line?
[soldier] Not yet, sir.
[Marshall] You know what to do.
Is Greely being jammed?
No. It's like someone turned off the system at the source.
translation.ko: 아닙니다, 누군가 통신망을 끊어 버린 것 같습니다

translation.en: Corporal Rahul Shah. Joined us six months ago.
Captain.
Corporal.
And you remember Beaver.
Miss me, Captain?
Not even once.
[Marshall] How's our Russian friend?
[Beaver] He's back.
Forty miles out and just sitting there like a turd in a swimming pool.
-[Collins] What friend? -Russian attack sub.
translation.ko: 러시아 친구라뇨? 러시아 공격 잠수함이 몇 달째 귀찮게 굴어

translation.en: Been nosing about for months.
translation.ko: 러시아 공격 잠수함이 몇 달째 귀찮게 굴어

translation.en: Our subs keep chasing him away and he keeps coming back.
translation.ko: 우리 잠수함이 쫓아내도 계속 다시 와

translation.en: What the hell's going on up there?
Hey. We still on for tonight?
Dude, what?
Poker. I want to whip them janitors like last time.
-Not now, Beaver. -What's wrong with now?
We're in an emergency.
Man, this ain't no emergency.
It's one crackpot with a grudge.
I'd invite you, ma'am,
but there'll probably be a bit of locker room talk.
translation.ko: 하지만 남자들끼리 지저분한 얘기도 할 겁니다

translation.en: I've been practicing against some of the best players in the world
with this little green guy.
Thing's probably more powerful than this entire room.
Great story, Beaver.
In what chapter do you shut the fuck up?
Copy that, STRATCOM.
Sir, SBX-1 has just been assigned primary early warning status
translation.ko: 그릴리가 통신 두절인 동안 저희가 조기 경보 감시 임무를

translation.en: while Greely's offline.
All right, as of this moment we're the only interceptor platform
protecting the United States from a nuclear missile attack.
Square your shit away.
Focus on the job you've been trained to do.
Sir, we sure this is not some kind of drill or emergency test--
translation.ko: 대령님, 지금 이게 긴급 상황 대비 훈련이나…

translation.en: Quiet.
NSA is relaying chatter from Russia.
translation.ko: 국가안보국이 러시아 도청 내용을 중계 중입니다

translation.en: Kremlin just received a priority alert from the ICBM missile base in Tavlinka.
translation.ko: 타블린카에 있는 ICBM 관련 긴급 경보를 수신했답니다

translation.en: Tavlinka site under hostile attack.
Multiple casualties.
Unauthorized missile removal.
No way.
Sixteen Topol-M mobile missiles unaccounted for.
You're saying someone stole 16 ICBMs?
I'm not saying it. The Russians are.
Sir, Greely goes dark
and within 10 minutes a Russian base reports stolen nukes?
translation.ko: 10분도 안 돼 러시아에서 핵무기 도난을 보고했단 말입니까?

translation.en: Look, Greely's real, but this has to be a Russian exercise.
translation.ko: 그릴리는 실제 상황이지만 러시아는 훈련일 거다

translation.en: If it were real, the Pentagon would've called us by now.
translation.ko: 실제 상황이면 지금쯤 국방부에서 연락이 왔겠지

translation.en: SBX-1.
Yes, sir.
We are, sir.
It just came in now, sir.
We will, sir.
[in Russian] We have 16 missiles aimed at 16 American cities.
translation.ko: 탄도 미사일 16기가 미국 16개 도시를 조준하고 있다

translation.en: After this day, America will no longer exist.
Jesus.
How do you steal nuclear missiles?
Had to have been an inside job. You can't just walk in--
Doesn't matter how they did it. What matters is those missiles are mobile.
translation.ko: 어떻게 훔쳤든 중요하지 않아 중요한 건 이 미사일들이 이동식이고

translation.en: They can hide their nukes anywhere.
Our satellites won't spot them till they launch.
Captain.
[Marshall] JJ.
This is on us now, you understand?
[Collins] Yes, sir.
We're the only thing standing between America and Armageddon.
You up for this?
Don't worry about me, sir.
Sorry. Had to ask.
I'll start the emergency lockdown.
You do that.
I need to find Welsh and secure the HVAR codes.
translation.ko: 난 웰시한테 가서 HVAR 코드를 확인하겠다

translation.en: Sir, wait Sir.
If they had people inside Tavlinka,
and the shooters at Greely were all ours,
they might have someone… here.
Go.
[man] The keycard!
[man] The keycard! Get the keycard!
Mikael! The door. Open the door!
Goddammit, you're a big boy.
Did you send the SOS?
Did you just stab that dude in the eye with your gun?
Yeah. Did you send the SOS?
Yeah, I sent it. They told me to stand by.
[Collins] How is Beaver?
Bullet clipped him. He's unconscious, but he'll be okay.
Is that acid?
[Shah] Why would they bring acid?
Destroy the circuitry.
Make this place useless.
What are we going to do?
You want to talk about it?
Leave now and you might escape with your life.
translation.ko: 지금 떠나면 목숨은 건질 수 있어

translation.en: Let me in
and you might escape with yours.
You are the terrorists who stole the missiles from Tavlinka?
[man] You know, it would be a hell of a coincidence if I wasn't.
Put one on Beaver.
And the shooters at Greely?
Subcontractors.
It's a gig economy.
Can't work at a US base without an extensive background check.
translation.ko: 미군 기지에서 일하려면 신원이 확실해야 할 텐데

translation.en: You're telling me. The paperwork is a nightmare.
That would mean you've been planning this--
[man] For a very long time.
[Collins] How long is a very long time?
Six years.
Not going so well for you, is it?
No plan survives contact with the enemy completely intact.
translation.ko: 적이 엮였을 땐 어떤 계획도 완전할 순 없지

translation.en: Are we enemies? You sound American.
[man] I am American.
And whether or not you and I are enemies
is completely up to you.
What's your name?
My name is Alexander Kessel.
You say that like I should know it.
And now that you do, you will never forget it.
translation.ko: 이제 알았으니 영원히 잊지 못할 거야

translation.en: How about I just call you "asshole"?
You know, usually it takes a woman a second date to reach that conclusion.
translation.ko: 보통 여자들은 두 번은 만나보고 퇴짜를 놓던데

translation.en: Nothing usual about me.
You know, I'm kind of getting that.
So, Captain, seems as though you and I are at an impasse
translation.ko: 대위, 우리 둘 다 교착상태에 빠진 것 같군

translation.en: because I need to disable your command center
so my people in Russia can fire those missiles.
And you need to keep me out.
But, full disclosure,
I have contained or killed everyone else on this vessel,
so I will be getting into that room.
Let me in now
and I will spare your lives.
And let millions of Americans die?
I don't think you realize why someone joins the Army.
You are alone in the middle of the ocean,
miles from any port,
way beyond the nearest shipping lane.
No one is going to be able to get here and save you
translation.ko: 아무도 너희를 구하러 올 수 없어

translation.en: before I cut through these doors.
translation.ko: 그 전에 내가 문을 열 거다

translation.en: Hey, Shah, how many janitors are there?
I don't know. Six, seven?
-Which is it, six or seven? -[Shah] I don't know. I didn't hire them.
translation.ko: 정확히 몇이야? 제가 고용한 것도 아니고 모릅니다!

translation.en: This is a big rig.
You couldn't have killed everyone so quickly.
translation.ko: 이렇게 빨리 모두를 죽일 순 없어

translation.en: [Kessel] Nerve agent.
Released it through the A/C. Put 'em all right to sleep.
[snorts] Bullshit.
If it makes any difference, they felt nothing.
We did have to shoot them to be sure.
[Kessel] Don't worry.
The command center has its own A/C, and try as I might…
You can't access it.
Would we be having this awesome little conversation if I could?
-SBX-1. This is Captain Collins. -Is this real?
-General Dyson. Where's Colonel Marshall? -[man] Everyone quiet.
translation.ko: - 다이슨 장군이다, 마셜 대령은? - 다들 조용히

translation.en: He's dead, sir.
Dead? What happened?
Six to seven terrorists disguised as janitors seized our vessel.
They killed Marshall, they claim they have killed the crew,
translation.ko: 마셜 대령을 죽였고 대원들을 죽였다고 주장하면서

translation.en: -and tried to take the command center. -Tried?
-And failed. -[Dyson] Who's there with you?
Corporals Shah and Baker.
Baker's unconscious. Hit by a bullet.
How secure are you?
They're using blowtorches to cut through the outer door.
translation.ko: 놈들이 토치로 외측 안전문을 뜯고 있습니다

translation.en: Best guess…
Sixty minutes.
Make that 30 minutes.
-[Dyson] And the inner door? -Same. I don't know.
What can you tell us about these terrorists?
American. Leader says his name is Alexander Kessel.
Get me a full background check on this guy. What else?
translation.ko: 전부 조사해서 가져와 다른 건 없나?

translation.en: They move like they've been trained,
and they're using nerve agents.
What's happening at Greely?
Shooters are dead.
Unfortunately, so are the computers that control the interceptors.
Burned them all with acid.
So it's just us.
Afraid so.
A SEAL team is inbound to you.
You have to hang on a little longer.
-ETA? -Ninety minutes.
Are they joking?
-No, we are not joking. -[Collins] Madam President.
The terrorists have 16 mobile missile launchers
that we and the Russians cannot find.
Only reason they haven't launched them yet
is because you still have control of your interceptors.
The second you don't,
they will launch those missiles on the United States.
Now, we don't have time to evacuate 16 cities,
so we're counting on you to keep those maniacs out of that room.
translation.ko: 그러니 여러분이 그곳을 지키는 수밖에 없습니다

translation.en: Understood, Madam President.
We'll get back to you soon. Keep us updated.
Yes, sir.
Captain, hold that room.
[soldier] Let's move out! Go!
[operator] SEAL team, you are clear for immediate departure to SBX-1.
Ninety minutes? There's no way we can last that long.
Not without a fight.
What? No. No, no.
I'm not a fighter. I'm a signal specialist.
I sit at a desk and stare at a screen, and know what? I like it.
translation.ko: 책상에 앉아서 화면만 봅니다 전 그게 좋습니다

translation.en: Know why? Because nothing ever happens.
I mean, I haven't fired a gun since basic.
Don't worry. Guns still work the same.
translation.ko: 걱정 마, 총 쏘는 법은 안 변했어

translation.en: Look, you can't count on me. You can't.
You surrender?
Do you?
Still quite enjoying fucking up your day.
Do you know anything about the fall of Rome?
When the barbarians massed outside the city gates
they did unspeakable things to try and force the Romans to let them in.
translation.ko: 입에 담지도 못할 짓을 하면서 로마인에게 문을 열라고 했지

translation.en: Exitus actum probat. "The result justifies the deed."
You remember Captain Welsh?
He's a father of four and a grandfather of seven.
[Collins] This is not gonna work.
Open the doors.
You can't let him die.
I will not open these doors.
If you don't, I will kill him.
I will not open these doors.
Last chance.
No.
Kill anyone you want.
I will never open this door.
We're going to die too, aren't we?
We are not gonna die.
They're gonna get in here. They're gonna kill us.
-Corporal. -There's nothing we can do to stop them!
Corporal Shah, they're not in here yet,
translation.ko: 샤 상병, 놈들은 아직 문밖에 있어

translation.en: but if we're going to keep them out, I need you thinking clearly.
translation.ko: 계속 못 들어오게 막으려면 정신 바짝 차려야 해

translation.en: We still have a job to do, right?
Right.
So go back to your post and keep our scanners on Tavlinka.
And if they launch?
We intercept.
We also need to figure out every way they can penetrate this room.
translation.ko: 놈들이 침투할 수 있는 통로들을 생각해 보자

translation.en: Tunnel's the only direct way, in or out.
What about indirect? Any new piping or conduits I should know about?
translation.ko: 간접 통로는? 새로 깐 파이프나 도관은 없어?

translation.en: Plumbing comes through a conduit in the floor
too small for anyone to fit through.
Same for the cables.
What else could they do? Think.
What about blowing the radar dome?
Dome's reinforced even stronger than we are.
Same with the interceptors.
Get me eyes outside the hatches, top and bottom.
Get the shotgun.
Shoot him!
Shoot him now!
Looks like it was just the one.
When was the last time this thing was test fired?
I don't know. Can it still work?
Not without blowing up in your face.
-What about your pistol? -Out.
[sighs] So we have no weapons.
Help me.
[Shah] Thanks for saving Turbo.
[Collins] Who?
Turbo, the turtle. My kids gave him to me.
translation.ko: 거북이, 터보 말입니다 제 아이들이 줬습니다

translation.en: How many kids you got?
Prisha, she's nine. Aditi, seven. And Kalyan, he's three.
I haven't seen them for six months.
Best thing you can do for them now is help me stop those missiles.
translation.ko: 네 아이들을 위한 최선은 미사일을 막는 거야

translation.en: Anything?
[Shah] They got everyone.
He's just going to keep buzzing till you answer.
translation.ko: 대위님이 받을 때까지 계속 걸 겁니다

translation.en: [Shah] What do you want now?
Captain, you should see this.
Think you're the first one to throw that in my face?
translation.ko: 그걸 들이댄 게 네가 처음일 것 같아?

translation.en: Think you're gonna break me?
No.
And yes.
-[Collins] It's gonna take more than that. -I've got more coming.
translation.ko: 좀 더 노력해 봐 보여 줄 게 더 있어

translation.en: No, you don't. You're scrambling.
-[Kessel] Am I? -Desperately.
How so?
You're a planner.
Six years, you said.
Looking for ways to beat the security, getting your people aboard,
translation.ko: 보안을 뚫고 부하들 데리고 승선할 방법을 찾느라

translation.en: you must have gone over and over these things
until you were absolutely sure you planned for every possible outcome,
translation.ko: 모든 변수에 대비해서 완벽한 계획을 짰겠지

translation.en: but you couldn't plan for me.
You know how I know?
Because I'm meant to be in Fort Hunter right now on my new post.
translation.ko: 난 원래 지금쯤 새 부임지인 헌터 기지에 있어야 하는데

translation.en: Only fell through late last night when they reassigned me here.
translation.ko: 어젯밤 늦게서야 위에서 날 여기로 재배치했지

translation.en: And now…
Now you can't beat me.
I'll give you "unexpected."
But not unbeatable.
See, here's what I know.
I know that three years ago, you scored your dream job.
translation.ko: 3년 전 넌 꿈에 그리던 자리를 얻었어

translation.en: Pentagon, three-star General.
A battlefield hero, his troops loved him.
They were going to build a statue to the guy.
And he promised to take you all the way to the top,
translation.ko: 장군은 네게 정상까지 끌어 주겠다고 약속했어

translation.en: but then you learned the price you'd have to pay.
translation.ko: 하지만 넌 대가가 따른다는 걸 깨닫지

translation.en: I know the Army review board just decided you made it all up.
translation.ko: 군 심의회에서는 네가 지어낸 얘기라고 했고

translation.en: Threw you right back into the lion's den.
translation.ko: 널 다시 그 사자 우리에 처넣었지

translation.en: I know that three-star welcomed you with open arms.
Because predators always want to show you exactly who's in charge.
translation.ko: 언제나 포식자들은 누가 위인지 보여주고 싶어 하니까

translation.en: Wait, that general got discharged.
Which means you beat him. You won.
She won the battle, not the war.
See, first came the hate mail.
The bounty hunt for these lewd photos…
translation.ko: "거짓말쟁이 걸레 넌 배신자야" 외설적인 사진에 현상금이 걸리고

translation.en: …then the death threats.
[Kessel] All from within the army that you so proudly served.
translation.ko: 네가 자부심을 갖고 복무하던 육군에서 일어난 일이야

translation.en: Then finally…
that night.
[man] JJ! JJ!
JJ, come on!
Come on, wake up. JJ!
Come on. Wake up. Come back.
Papa?
It's okay, it's okay. Papa's here. It's okay. I got you.
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 아빠 여기 왔어 그래, 내가 있어

translation.en: Papa… sorry.
You are beatable, Captain.
It's been proven.
If you are so right,
then what am I doing here?
Why do I still wear the uniform?
War's not over yet, motherfucker.
You should be working with me.
In fact, I will give you 30 million dollars if you open these doors.
translation.ko: 내가 3천만 달러를 줄게 이 문만 열어

translation.en: I will have you flown to the country of your choosing
where you can live the rest of your life in luxury.
If anyone has earned the right to walk away from this, it's you.
translation.ko: 여기를 떠날 자격이 있는 사람이 있다면 바로 너야

translation.en: Thirty million dollars.
What did the Army ever give you?
Your depressing old job in the middle of nowhere,
where they can forget about you?
They don't care about you.
Open these doors.
Take back your power.
That's how you win a war.
[pilot] SEAL team is inbound to SBX-1. ETA 67 minutes.
translation.ko: 실 팀이 SBX-1로 가고 있다 67분 후 도착 예정

translation.en: [Collins] They're in.
Open the door and you leave here a wealthy woman.
translation.ko: 문 열어 그럼 부자가 돼서 나갈 수 있어

translation.en: We still have time before you cut through this door.
translation.ko: 이 문이 열릴 때까진 시간이 있어

translation.en: -You really don't. -[gun cocks]
-[Collins] Beaver. -[Shah] What?
[Collins] Nice, Beaver.
Initiating satellite relay and EBS hack.
We're in.
No, I have a new one.
ZSB, Zulu Sierra Bravo, 1-9-9-6.
And tell Danny to move in.
Are you hurt?
I've had worse.
It really didn't have to be this way.
If Corporal Baker doesn't get hit, we avoid all of this.
translation.ko: 비버가 기절하지만 않았어도 이런 일은 없었을 거야

translation.en: If you're gonna kill me, just kill me.
No mansplaining.
I gave you choices.
It was your decision to become enemies.
You were with them this whole time?
Yeah.
[Shah grunts] Traitor.
America's the traitor.
[Collins] Always were full of shit, Beaver.
[Beaver] Ah, what do you know?
I love my country.
Hell, there was a time I would have even died for it. [sniffs]
translation.ko: 한때는 조국을 위해 목숨도 바칠 수 있었지

translation.en: Never too late.
Shut up.
It's because of immigrants like you
and like you
that I lost my job
and the government took away my rights,
started making up all kinds of shit to scare me.
translation.ko: 그러더니 온갖 것들로 날 위협하기 시작했지

translation.en: [Beaver] Shit. I don't even recognize America these days.
And that gives you the right to murder millions of people?
translation.ko: 그게 수백만 명을 죽일 이유가 되나?

translation.en: Well, it gives me the right to start looking out for myself.
translation.ko: 내게 가장 좋은 게 뭔지 알게 해 줬지

translation.en: And now I got ten million ways to do that.
Money? That's what this is about?
It's what America's about.
And if you don't get that,
you obviously haven't been paying attention, Shah.
translation.ko: 넌 정신을 못 차린 거야, 샤

translation.en: Wake up, man.
Yeah, sure. Sure. Blame America. Blame the government.
Blame everyone else but you.
That's what all losers do.
You just keep on talking, darlin'.
Because before this is all over,
I'm gonna do to you
what every enlisted grunt secretly wants to do
translation.ko: 비밀리에 여성 장교한테 하고 싶어 하는 짓을

translation.en: to every female officer.
The only way you can get it, isn't it?
Hey. Another thing.
Never call a woman by anything other than her name.
translation.ko: 절대 여자를 이름 이외의 호칭으로 부르지 마

translation.en: Not honey, or honey pie, or sugar, or sugar pie,
translation.ko: 허니, 허니파이도 안 돼 슈거, 슈거파이도 안 돼

translation.en: or sweetie, or sweetie pie.
Not baby, sweetheart, ho, bitch,
translation.ko: 베이비도, 스위트하트도 걸레도, 쌍년도 안 돼

translation.en: and above all, most of all, beyond all else,
translation.ko: 그중에서도 무엇보다 그 어떤 일이 있어도

translation.en: don't ever, ever, call her "darlin'."
Satellite relay's live on the EBS.
The Emergency Broadcast System?
Yeah, so that every camera on this rig
can be broadcast to any device that has smart capabilities.
Wouldn't want anyone missing the show.
Mr. Kessel. Where's Captain Collins?
She's here. She's unharmed.
Well… relatively.
As is Corporal Shah.
[Dyson] And Corporal Baker?
Howdy, General.
[Dyson] You two are servicemen.
You took an oath.
How could you betray your country?
I swore an oath to the old America. Not this one.
translation.ko: 내가 맹세한 건 옛날 미국이지 지금 미국이 야냐

translation.en: [Dyson] What do you want?
[Kessel] From you?
Nothing.
I'm just waiting for America to join our little chat here.
Dad's proud. That must be nice.
EBS has slaved all signals.
Say hello to America, boss.
So you know it's got a big screen, great picture quality, you know,
the sound's kind of meh,
but I don't really listen to the TV that much.
translation.ko: 전 TV 볼 때 소리는 잘 안 들어요

translation.en: I play music when I watch and stuff so it doesn't really…
Why'd it go black and white?
Where's the President?
I'm here.
If you launch even one of those missiles,
I swear before God that we will hunt you down
and wipe you from existence.
That's enough. You're boring me.
I'm taking your bully pulpit now.
My fellow Americans, I am Alexander Kessel,
translation.ko: 미국 시민 여러분 난 알렉산더 케셀입니다

translation.en: son of trust fund billionaire, Alexander Kessel Senior,
translation.ko: 신탁 기금, 억만장자 알렉산더 케셀 시니어의 아들이죠

translation.en: who you may also know
is the current utterly unqualified US ambassador to the United Nations.
translation.ko: 내 아버지는 현재 형편없는 유엔 주재 미국 대사입니다

translation.en: Now, my associates in Russia control 16 nuclear missiles,
translation.ko: 러시아의 내 동료들이 미사일 16기를 갖고 있고

translation.en: and I control the only interceptor missiles
translation.ko: 그 미사일을 막을 수 있는 유일한 인터셉터 통제실은

translation.en: that are capable of stopping them.
Sixteen American cities have been targeted.
300 million of you will die.
One city will be destroyed first
so that the rest of you can watch in horror.
Missile team one…
fire.
[computer voice] Missile launch detected. Missile launch detected. Missile launch detected.
Intercept launch expires in 12 minutes.
[Kessel] Now in 12 minutes, that missile I just launched,
will pass over my head,
at which point, it will be too late for this interceptor to catch it.
But which city has been chosen?
Is it yours?
Wherever it lands, there's no time to run.
You can't flee.
If you guessed Los Angeles,
congratulations.
The City of Angels has 23 minutes left to live.
Wait a second.
Once Los Angeles is gone,
And the fear of every American is at its peak…
translation.ko: 이봐요, 저기 잠깐만요, 우리 아직 영업해요

translation.en: We're not closing yet.
…I will launch a second wave of 15 nuclear missiles.
San Francisco, Seattle, Las Vegas,
Cincinnati, Dallas, Denver, Memphis, Chicago, St. Louis, Atlanta, Boston,
translation.ko: 신시내티, 댈러스 덴버, 멤피스, 시카고 세인트루이스, 애틀랜타, 보스턴 필라델피아, 마이애미, 뉴욕

translation.en: Philadelphia, Miami, New York.
translation.ko: 세인트루이스, 애틀랜타, 보스턴 필라델피아, 마이애미, 뉴욕

translation.en: And of course, Washington DC.
Today…
America dies in a paroxysm of fear.
America is the greatest lie ever told.
American exceptionalism?
Maybe once.
When the founders got rid of kings.
When they declared that all men are created equal.
Now they say ours are United States, but when was that true?
Was it true during the Civil War?
Or Jim Crow?
Hell, is it true now?
You know, this national lie, it's a festering wound,
and it's fatal.
There's no Band-Aid to patch it.
No, the only way to save our nation and the promise it once held
translation.ko: 우리 나라를 살리고 예전 같은 약속의 땅이 되려면

translation.en: is to erase it. Start over.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 지우고 새로 시작해야 합니다

translation.en: So maybe then. when we are staring at each other
translation.ko: 그런 후에야 우리는 서로를 마주 보며

translation.en: from across the rubble,
we will all agree that this time
we're going to get America right.
This is Corporal Rahul Shah.
Do you like being an American, Rahul?
With all my heart.
But you're a Hindu. You can be both.
In America?
You've never been mocked for your faith?
Never been the subject to enhanced screenings at airports?
translation.ko: 공항에서 정밀 심사 대상자가 된 적은?

translation.en: Share with the world what you've seen.
I've seen you in the showers,
and I can see why you're obsessed with missiles.
Pathetic.
I got this, boss. [inhaling]
This is Captain Joanna Julia Collins.
translation.ko: 이 사람은 조애나 훌리아 콜린스 대위입니다

translation.en: JJ to her friends.
A soldier who has fought with honor and courage here today.
Now, three years ago, one of our nation's top generals
translation.ko: 3년 전, 우리나라의 최고위 장성 중 하나가

translation.en: tried to abuse his position of power and force her to have sex with him.
translation.ko: 자기 지위를 이용해 강제로 섹스를 하려고 했습니다

translation.en: Whose career was ruined?
showering her with praise,
but she's a woman,
so instead her fellow service members
put out a bounty hunt on photos like this.
translation.ko: 찬사 대신 이런 사진에 상금을 걸었습니다

translation.en: You're an asshole, dude.
I offered her 30 million dollars to give up her post today.
She refused.
She took that photo for charity, by the way.
What position were you? Were you goalkeeper?
Goalkeeper. It's a tough position.
Beg your pardon?
You take a lot of hits, concussions, bruised ribs,
translation.ko: 많이 맞기도 하고 뇌진탕, 갈비뼈에 멍들고

translation.en: but the most common injury is dislocated thumbs.
-[grunts] -[Beaver] Oh shit.
[Kessel] No! Shit! [panting]
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in six minutes.
Think you can make it?
Do you?
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in five minutes.
You have five minutes. Hold her or kill her.
[computer voice] Interceptor launched.
[computer voice] Missile intercepted.
Fucking die already, would you?
Remember? I said, "Whatever happens, make sure you shoot her first." [sniffs]
translation.ko: 기억하지? 무슨 일이 있어도 저 여자부터 쏘랬잖아

translation.en: "You just take her out of the fight, because if you don't do that,
if you don't just put her down right away, man, she's gonna be trouble."
Beaver.
She's… She's just one of those women, you know?
She just likes to just get under your skin and just needle you, man.
translation.ko: 사람을 짜증 나게 해 바늘처럼 말이야

translation.en: Like a… like a fucking needle.
This is a setback and nothing more.
[Beaver] Setback?
Oh. Good.
Hey, did you hear that? It's a setback. That's cool.
She shot the goddamn missile out of the sky!
It's one missile. There are 15 left.
And what happens if she shoots them down too, huh?
What then? What do we do then?
Our faces, man, they're all over the world right now.
What do we do then?
What's the statute of limitations on attempted nuking?
We are prepared for this. We have backup plans.
translation.ko: 이것도 다 대비해 뒀어 대비책이 있어

translation.en: Really? [sighs]
You played that one pretty close to the buzzer.
[panting] Doing my best here, ma'am.
Can you turn off the TV coverage?
Give me a minute.
Not from here.
[Dyson] Understood.
How long till the SEALS get here?
Fifty minutes. They're going as fast as they can.
Not fast enough.
[Dyson] And we got some background on Alexander Kessel.
He was Army, military intelligence.
Started out doing Russian work,
then became a psy ops and torture specialist.
[Collins] Torture?
[Dyson] He was good. Too good sometimes.
Killed two prisoners while he was torturing them.
[Collins] Jesus. I'm dealing with a genuine psychopath.
You're not alone. Lot of smart people here trying to figure out a way to help you.
translation.ko: 자네는 혼자가 아니야 여기 많은 분이 도와줄 방법을 찾고 있네

translation.en: Tacticians, game theorists.
Fuck theory.
I need some fucking soldiers with guns. I hear you, Captain.
translation.ko: - 총 든 군인들이나 보내주십시오! - 알고 있다, 대위

translation.en: Come on, give her some guns, man.
If you don't mind me saying, you are one armor-plated woman.
translation.ko: 이런 말 괜찮을지 모르겠지만 자네는 강철보다 강해

translation.en: Army never should have picked a fight with you.
Got that right.
Rahul.
What'd I miss?
Not much.
Did we stop the missile?
Yeah. We stopped it.
Nice.
Wait. Where's all the bad guys?
That Alexander dude must be pissed at you.
Yeah, well, that's because I'm still fucking up his day.
translation.ko: 그래야지, 아직도 놈의 하루를 망치고 있으니

translation.en: [Collins] Papa?
Hey. How you feeling?
You up for some soup?
Sure.
You saw what they did.
[Papa] I'll take care of it.
Do not let them get to you now. Don't let them win.
translation.ko: 그들에게 신경 쓰지 마라 그들에게 지지 마

translation.en: They hate me.
You told the truth.
Nobody cares about the truth.
[Papa] I care.
I've lost everything. Everything I ever worked for.
translation.ko: 전부 잃었어요 지금까지 노력한 걸 전부요

translation.en: Hey, hey.
What's the one thing I've taught you since you were little?
translation.ko: 아주 어릴 때부터 내가 가르쳐 준 게 뭐지?

translation.en: The one rule in life?
Never stop fighting.
[Papa] You got fight in you, kid.
Always have. Just like your mama.
[Shah] Captain?
He wants to talk.
How long have I been out?
[Shah] Not long. Fifteen minutes or so.
[Collins] What now, asshole?
You think I'm a monster.
I was.
You know, growing up, I never summered where I wintered. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 난 어릴 때 사계절을 한곳에서 보내지 못했어

translation.en: I was either on a yacht in the Hamptons or skiing in Val d'Isère.
translation.ko: 햄프턴에서 요트를 타거나 발디제르에서 스키를 탔지

translation.en: Sucks to be you, dude.
I'm not complaining.
I was the product of a failed society.
A society that consistently rewards money and ignores everything else.
translation.ko: 끝없이 돈으로 보상하고 나머지는 무시하는 사회 말야

translation.en: What? You think my father became ambassador to the UN
translation.ko: 우리 아버지가 UN 대사가 된 게

translation.en: because of any worthwhile diplomatic skills
translation.ko: 외교 능력이 뛰어나기 때문인 줄 알아?

translation.en: or because of his political donations?
See, that's what we do in America.
We just figure because someone's rich that means they're smart.
translation.ko: 부자를 보면 그 사람들이 똑똑한 줄 알지

translation.en: My father's a moron.
He inherited his money.
-He didn't earn it. -God.
Don't tell me this is about daddy issues.
I wouldn't expect you to understand.
I understand plenty.
Your father is a good man.
The best.
He served too, didn't he?
Thirty-six years.
[Kessel] That's how he met your mom? When he was stationed in Spain?
translation.ko: 네 엄마도 그렇게 만났고? 스페인에서 주둔할 때?

translation.en: Does he still hang out with his army buddies?
[Collins] Every day.
In Scottsdale, right?
Yeah.
[Kessel] The Patriot's Valley Veterans Retirement Home.
Room 6B.
Papa?
Let him go!
-He's got nothing to do with this! -Beg to differ.
Let him go!
You said I could kill whoever, and you'd never open this door.
translation.ko: 누구를 죽이든 이 문은 안 연다고 했었지

translation.en: Let him go, God damn you!
-[Kessel] Let's see if that's still valid. -Fuck you!
translation.ko: 그 말이 아직도 유효한지 보지 엿 먹어!

translation.en: You think it's going to go any other way?
This is what I was trained for. Psy ops. Military intelligence.
translation.ko: 내가 훈련받은 게 이거야 심리전, 군 정보전!

translation.en: Find your enemy's weak point and exploit it.
[gasps] Let him go!
If you don't open the door,
I will take apart your father piece by piece.
No!
-Fine. Have it your way. -No, no! Please. No, no, no!
-Do it. -No, no, no! No, don't! No!
-[Collins] No, no, no! -[groaning]
-You know I can't. -[Kessel] Yes, you can.
translation.ko: 열 수 없다는 거 알잖아 열 수 있어

translation.en: -No, I can't. -You can make this stop whenever you want.
translation.ko: 언제든 네가 원하면 멈출 수 있어

translation.en: Let me speak with him. Let me speak with him. Okay?
-Let me speak with him! -Captain, no.
Let her speak.
[Collins] Papa?
-JJ. -I can't…
I can't… I can't lose you.
Listen to me. Are you listening?
Never stop fighting!
-Kill him. -No! No!
-No, please God. God! -[gunshot]
No! [sobs] No, no!
No!
My daddy would have made me open that door.
No question!
[Shah] How did they know?
How did they know to have people in Scottsdale?
translation.ko: 스코츠데일에 계신 걸 어떻게 알았단 말입니까?

translation.en: The Army signed your transfer order last night, right?
[panting] Right.
Which means they couldn't have known until a few hours ago.
translation.ko: 그럼 저들도 몇 시간 전까지 몰랐을 텐데

translation.en: [Kessel] You still don't get it? You're a pariah in your own ranks.
translation.ko: 아직도 모르겠어? 군에서 널 버린 거야

translation.en: The decision to have you transferred to this godforsaken rig
was made three days ago. They only told you last night.
translation.ko: 3일 전에 결정해 놓고 어젯밤에 통보한 거야

translation.en: I've known for 72 hours.
-[sharp inhale] What are you doing? -Activating my insurance policy.
translation.ko: 뭐 하는 거야? 나도 대안을 생각해 뒀거든

translation.en: If she's committed enough to watch her father die,
translation.ko: 아버지가 죽는 걸 볼 정도로 진심이라면

translation.en: you will find that I am equally as committed.
That's the HVAR code. The emergency sinking protocol.
translation.ko: 그건 HVAR 코드야 긴급 침몰 프로토콜이라고

translation.en: You're going to sink this whole rig?
Our telemetry's saying SBX-1's asset removal protocol just activated.
translation.ko: 방금 자체 침몰 기능 활성화가 감지됐다

translation.en: Don't tell me he--
He's going to sink us. [gasps]
He's going to sink us using our own scuttling protocol.
translation.ko: 자체 침몰 기능을 이용해 수장시키려는 겁니다

translation.en: [computer voice] High value asset removal protocol activated.
What do we do?
As long as we are above the surface, we can still fire our missiles.
translation.ko: 물 위에 있는 한 미사일은 요격할 수 있어

translation.en: [computer voice] Thirteen minutes until total vessel submersion.
We've got 13 minutes to figure out a solution.
I'm going down there.
[Shah] Down where? Into the hulls?
Yes. To close the valves one by one.
You can't go down there with wounds like that.
I'll manage.
I'll… I'll go.
No.
I'll do it.
[Dyson] You're running out of time. We clock it at 13 minutes.
So do we.
What's the ETA on the SEAL team?
Twenty-five.
[sighs] Damn. I'll call you back.
All right.
Don't think this is what heroes look like.
That's exactly what they look like.
Whatever you say, Captain.
You can do this.
[Shah] You got this, Rahul.
You got this.
See you on the other side.
Little bastard grew some balls.
Take care of it.
This is mine.
HVAR's been activated. Twelve and a half minutes.
Well, how far away is he?
[pilot] Twenty-two minutes out. Ready your weapons.
Okay, I've reached the hull.
You see the console?
This is gonna take a while.
-[Collins] You just have to slow it down. -[Shah] Copy that.
How are we looking, Captain?
[computer voice] Recalculating. Recalculating.
-12 minutes 11 seconds until… -[Collins] You just bought us two minutes.
Keep going.
Hell, yeah. I'm an ass-kicking, valve-closing machine.
Nobody plugs leaks like me.
-Oh. Shit. -What?
I got company.
Get out of there. You hear me?
[Shah] It's too late.
It's not too late. Get out of there, now.
I'm sorry I couldn't help you more before, Captain,
but I'm hoping this helps you now.
[computer voice] Recalculating. Recalculating.
Tell my children I love them.
Howdy.
You don't have to do this, Beaver.
You're not a murderer.
You're right.
I'm not a murderer.
I'm a fucking patriot.
Rahul? Rahul?
[Beaver] Shah can't come to the phone right now.
translation.ko: 샤는 지금 전화를 받을 수 없습니다

translation.en: It's just you and the three of us.
You're dead.
It was a valiant attempt.
I admire his courage, truly.
To be honest, I'd written him off.
His psych evaluation said he'd fold under pressure.
I didn't even bother to put people on his family.
Turns out, he almost derailed me.
Danilov.
No, I have a new one.
ZSB, Zulu, Sierra, Bravo, 1-9-9-6.
Tell Danny to move in.
Danny?
Cut the feed.
That means nothing.
Then you won't mind if I show it to the world.
Fine.
What the hell just happened?
ZSB. Zurich Schweitz Bank.
That's a Swiss bank account.
I should have known. [inhales]
You're not a nuclear terrorist or a fanatic.
You've been paid for this.
Hey, this is my operation. I'm the one in charge.
So what if I'm getting paid? Huh? Am I wrong?
I'm destroying a system that tried to destroy you.
translation.ko: 난 널 파괴하려 했던 시스템을 파괴하려는 거야

translation.en: I'm making sure what happened to you doesn't happen to other women.
translation.ko: 다른 여자들은 네가 당한 일을 당하지 않게 만드는 거라고

translation.en: How much?
What are you doing?
Who's paying you?
Seriously, stop with the tape.
What about the Russian sub?
Stop taping the window?
The Danilov, huh? Yeah, how's Danny?
Can you please…
Please stop taping the window. For me?
translation.ko: 창문에 테이프 좀 그만 붙일래? 날 위해서?

translation.en: You paid off a sub captain. Where is he taking you?
translation.ko: 잠수함 함장한테 돈 줬겠지 어디로 갈 건데?

translation.en: Stop taping the window.
Someplace you can get a new name, a new face?
translation.ko: 새 이름에 새 얼굴로 살 수 있는 곳?

translation.en: Somewhere you can spend your blood money?
translation.ko: 그 더러운 돈을 쓸 수 있는 곳?

translation.en: Stop with the damn tape, JJ.
What about all that shit about your father?
Oh, fuck him. He ruined my family's name!
Today I restore it with dignity and respect.
translation.ko: 오늘 내 덕에 가문이 위엄과 존엄을 되찾았지

translation.en: [Collins] Bullshit. I saw your file.
You're just a total fucking psycho.
-Thank you. -[Kessel] For what?
-[Collins] For showing me your weakness. -Oh, yeah. What's that?
[Collins] You want to get out of here alive.
[Kessel] You know what else I want? I want to hurt you, JJ.
translation.ko: 또 원하는 게 뭔지 알아? 널 고문하는 거야

translation.en: I want to cut off your fingers. I want you to beg me to kill you!
translation.ko: 손가락을 잘라 주지 죽여 달라고 빌게 만들겠어!

translation.en: Cabrón.
Good job cutting the live feed. SEALS are 17 minutes out.
translation.ko: 송출 잘 끊었다 실이 17분 후면 도착한다

translation.en: Well, that's not fast enough.
This rig is going to sink in 15 minutes.
And the second it goes under,
these assholes will launch all their nukes.
Is there anything you can do?
I sort of have this plan.
-But it's a little counterintuitive. -[President] Let's hear it, Captain.
translation.ko: 좀 무모한 것 같지만요 말해 봐요, 대위

translation.en: I let them take the command center.
What? That's precisely what we don't want to happen.
translation.ko: 뭐? 우리가 막으려는 일이 바로 그건데

translation.en: This rig is going down, and when it sinks, they win.
translation.ko: 기지가 가라앉고 있고 물에 잠기면 저들이 승리합니다

translation.en: We have to force them to fire the missiles before that happens.
translation.ko: 침몰하기 전에 미사일을 발사하게 만들어야 합니다

translation.en: And then what?
And then I retake the command center
and intercept their nukes.
[Dyson] Inside 12 minutes?
Yes, sir.
[Dyson] Hold on.
Fuck.
Our game theory specialist is not convinced.
He's uh… concerned about your motivations.
By my calculations,
your proposed plan has a 14% chance of success.
To give up that command center to a superior force
with no certainty of regaining it
is what we refer to as a negative outcome inducing event.
Are you serious with this shit?
Are you willing to gamble every life in America
on your ability to retake the center?
I am.
I'm sorry. I cannot endorse such a move.
translation.ko: 죄송하지만 저런 행동은 지지할 수 없습니다

translation.en: Listen, genius. You're saying my plan is running at 14%?
Yours is zero!
You haven't been beat up, strangled, or shot defending this rig today.
translation.ko: 오늘 여기를 방어하느라 몸 바친 건 댁이 아니잖아요

translation.en: So I think you'll find I'm kind of fucking motivated here.
translation.ko: 내가 여기 있는 게 당신이 찾는 동기입니다!

translation.en: We hear you, Captain.
I can do this, sir. I know I can.
Half the people here think you're crazy.
The other half think you're a rock star.
Fortunately, I'm one of the latter.
Do what you have to do, Captain.
[Collins] Still there?
-What do you think? -[Collins] I think you're getting nervous.
If you fail here, your partners will kill you.
You want this room? Come and get it.
[whispers] Intercom off.
Give me the radio.
Beaver, what's your ETA?
[Beaver] About 30 seconds.
She's taped up the window. I can't see in the room.
translation.ko: 창에 테이프를 붙여서 안을 볼 수가 없다

translation.en: I need you to get in there now.
[Beaver] Relax. I'm there.
I ain't see her. She gone.
[Kessel] What do you mean, gone? Where is she?
Shit.
[Kessel] What?
She's on the roof.
Attention all missile teams, we have control of the interceptor.
translation.ko: 모든 미사일 팀 들어라 인터셉터를 장악했다

translation.en: Fire all missiles. Repeat, fire all missiles.
translation.ko: 모든 미사일 발사해라 반복한다, 모두 발사해

translation.en: [computer voice] Multiple missile launch detected. Multiple missile launch detected.
[Beaver] Woo! Let's go, baby. Light 'em up!
[computer voice] Targets acquired. Targets acquired.
Seattle, San Francisco, Las Vegas, Denver, St. Louis, Memphis,
translation.ko: 시애틀, 샌프란시스코 라스베이거스, 덴버 세인트루이스, 멤피스

translation.en: Chicago, Cincinnati, Atlanta, Miami, Washington DC,
translation.ko: 시카고, 신시내티, 애틀랜타 마이애미, 워싱턴 DC

translation.en: Boston, New York, Dallas, Philadelphia.
Kill her.
[Beaver] She come for me.
"Come make ten million," he says.
"Buy yourself a private island," he says. "Piece of cake."
Oh, man. [inhales]
Nope.
Give me your knife.
Do it.
Acid.
[Beaver] Where are you, darlin'?
[in singsong] Come out, come out, wherever you are.
Apologies, ladies and gentlemen, for that rude interruption,
but as you can see,
I have retaken this command center and the nukes are on their way.
translation.ko: 내가 다시 통제실을 장악했고 핵미사일이 날아가고 있어요

translation.en: Hey, the goalie ain't up here.
She has to be. Where else could she…
…be?
She is on the roof, Beaver.
There's no one down here.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in eight minutes.
[whispers] Ivan.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in seven minutes.
Come on.
[Beaver] Can't let you do that, darlin'.
Let me go, Beaver. You don't want this.
translation.ko: 놔 줘, 비버 너도 이러고 싶지 않잖아

translation.en: Hell, I told you what I wanted.
You're gonna die here.
No, I'm not.
I'm on the next submarine out of here. [chuckles]
With Alexander?
He's gone. [panting]
-[Collins groans] -[Beaver] Bullshit.
I saw him go.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in five minutes.
[snickers] Really think a little bit of razor wire is gonna kill me?
translation.ko: 고작 철조망으로 날 죽일 수 있을 것 같아?

translation.en: Gravity, darlin'.
[father] JJ… JJ, come on.
What's the one thing I've taught you since you were little?
translation.ko: 아주 어릴 때부터 내가 가르쳐 준 게 뭐지?

translation.en: The one rule in life?
Never stop fighting.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in three minutes.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in 60 seconds.
There she is!
There she is!
Get up. Get up!
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in 40 seconds.
[panting] Don't give up. Don't give up.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in 30 seconds.
[computer voice] Intercept launch expires in 20 seconds.
[computer voice] Ten seconds. Nine, eight, seven, six,
five, four, three, two, one.
[computer voice] Interceptors launched.
Come on. Come on. Come on.
[computer voice] Multiple missile interception complete.
Yeah! Woo-hoo!
Fourteen percent.
[Kessel] Look at you.
Still going, huh?
You know you really did fuck up my day.
But I brought America to the brink,
translation.ko: 하지만 난 미국을 벼랑 끝으로 몰았고

translation.en: and I'll do it again.
You may have won the battle, but not the war.
[panting] Told you. War's not over yet.
This is for my dad, asshole.
[Kessel] There's my ride.
[Kessel] There's no room for you.
[man 1, in Russian] I've arrived. I can see him.
[man 2, in Russian] You know what to do.
[man 1] What about the woman?
[man 2] Your choice.
[pilot, in English] Target in sight. We'll arrive in 30 seconds.
Contact. Russian submarine looks like it's bugging out.
We have visual on Captain Collins on the roof.
Madam President.
They told me you were awake. It is good to see you, Captain.
Is Fort Greely--
[President] Greely's back up. Interceptors on standby.
And we're going to replace SBX-1 as soon as possible,
but don't worry, nobody is going to send you back out there.
translation.ko: 하지만 걱정 말아요 당신을 다시 보내진 않을 테니까

translation.en: In fact, I think a soldier of your caliber
would be better put to use on my National Security staff.
What do you say?
[President] I'll take that as a yes.
Thank you, Madam President.
Oh, and you have another visitor.
-Papa? -JJ.
I… I thought you were…
Turns out your dad has some very well-armed Army buddies
translation.ko: 알고 보니 무장한 전우들을 친구로 두셨더라고요

translation.en: watching over him in that retirement home.
They saw what was happening on TV.
Broke down my goddamn door.
Saved my finger. Lost my door.
Well, I'll expect you to report to the White House next week, Captain.
translation.ko: 그럼 다음 주에 백악관으로 출근하는 거로 알겠어요, 대위

translation.en: Come here. Dad.
[father] Hey.
This is for you.
Another survivor.
Turbo.
SEAL team found him swimming around the wreckage of SBX-1.
translation.ko: 실 팀이 SBX-1 잔해 주변에서 헤엄치고 있는 걸 발견했어

translation.en: He belonged to Corporal Shah.
[father sighs] I heard what happened. I'm sorry.
You know, sometimes it's…
it's best to talk about those we've lost so we don't forget.
translation.ko: 먼저 간 사람에 대해 얘기하며 추억하는 것도 좋단다

translation.en: His name was Rahul.
[father] Rahul?
He liked poker…
[father] I see.
…but he wasn't very good at it.
